summary: Lebanon, officially the Republic of Lebanon, is a small country in West Asia with a rich history dating back to 5000 BC. It has been part of various empires, including the Phoenician, Roman, and Byzantine. Over the centuries, it has also been ruled by different caliphates and Crusader states. Lebanon gained independence from France in 1943 and established a unique confessionalist government. However, its stability was disrupted by the Lebanese Civil War and military occupations. Today, Lebanon is a developing country facing economic challenges, but its culture and influence extend beyond its borders, and it plays an active role in various international organizations.
title: Lebanon
